intro: Leucheria nutans, commonly known as the leaning leucheria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are fragrant, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
